description: The State of Good Repair Grants Program (49 U.S.C. 5337) provides capital assistance for maintenance, replacement, and rehabilitation projects of high-intensity fixed guideway and bus systems to help transit agencies maintain assets in a state of good repair.

The BFP will provide funds to states by formula for bridge replacement, rehabilitation, preservation, protection, or construction projects on public roads. This program includes three set-asides: 15 percent for use on off-system bridges, 3 percent will be set-aside for use on Tribal Transportation Facility bridges, and 0.5 percent will be set-asidde for administrative expenses of the Federal Highway Administration.
